page.title: 13A TYPICAL DAY FOR MELANIE
page.content: It's 7 am and time to get up.I go to the wardrobe and put my school clothes on and rush downstairs to have breakfast: bacon, sausage, egg and a nice refreshing cup of tea.I then go to the kitchen and get my sandwiches, crisps,chocolate and a drink. Then I get my homework and I do it for ten minutes .I say goodbye and set off for school.I travel by bus; it costs 15 pence. I arrive at St Elizabeths at 9 am and play for 10 minutes until the bell goes - it hurts my ears - and then we go to our class. We have Religion; after that we have 45 minutes of Maths. Playtime follows shortly and after we have English (that's my favourite). At lunch time we eat for half-an-hour and then we go out to play. The bell rings at 1:15 and we go in; we have Science, Art, Geography or History.
